title: Attack on the Capitol: Four members of the far right Proud Boys militia convicted of 'seditious conspiracy'
description: The four men, including the armed group's leader Enrique Tarrio, were convicted and face up to 20 years in prison. The fate of a fifth man is still up in the air.

title: Understanding the symbolism of Buddha’s representations
description: To commemorate the birth, awakening and death of Siddhartha Gautama, known as 'the Buddha,' this Friday, May 5, 'Le Monde des religions' deciphers the main physical characteristics found in the representations in his effigy.

title: Jamaica and Belize consider becoming republics ahead of King Charles' coronation
description: The coronation is accelerating the Caribbean nations' plans to be the next Commonwealth countries to ditch the monarchy and become republics.

title: Napoli win their first Serie A title in 33 years
description: Victor Osimhen scored the decisive goal as Napoli secured it's third Italian league title and their first since Diego Maradona won the league in 1990.

title: Ed Sheeran wins plagiarism lawsuit over his song 'Thinking Out Loud'
description: The lawsuit was filed by heirs of Marvin Gaye's cowriter Ed Townsend who alleged that the English song writer plagarized the song 'Let's Get It On'.

title: The French army's training for high-intensity warfare
description: Several massive military exercises are being conducted in eastern France. The scenario simulates a situation similar to the conflict in Ukraine, with French forces and their allies being called upon by a fictional foreign country to stop the invading enemy's advance.

title: VP Harris meets with tech CEOs to discuss artificial intelligence risks
description: Whilst praising the potential of AI to improve people's lives, Kamala Harris warned that it also 'has the potential to dramatically increase threats to safety and security.'

title: Senegal: Macky Sall tempted by controversial third presidential term
description: Less than ten months before the presidential election, the president's party is preparing his candidacy. The opposition rejects that prospect.

title: Four Proud Boys convicted over January 6 Capitol attack
description: Enrique Tarrio, the former Proud Boys leader, was among those convicted in this milestone in the Justice Department’s prosecution of the pro-Trump rioters who stormed the Capitol in 2021.

title: May Day demonstrations: Why fewer fake AI-generated images generated were spread
description: There seems to be a lull in the development of AI-generated fake news images, but the creation of more sophisticated fakes is still very much a possibility.

title: Jamaican reggae legend Max Romeo plays France on farewell tour
description: The singer, who will perform at the Olympia in Paris on May 13, is set to release 'The Romeo Legacy,' a new album featuring all his hits in new versions with many guests.

title: Italian foreign minister cancels Paris trip over migration spat
description: France's Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin said on Thursday that Giorgia Meloni, Italy's prime minister, 'is incapable of resolving the migration problems' facing her country.

title: ECB raises interest rates by quarter-point to fight inflation
description: The European Central Bank's quarter-point hike follows evidence that its efforts are working by making mortgages and business loans harder to get.

title: Zelensky insists on creation of special court over  Russian aggression
description: The Ukrainian leader was speaking to diplomats and officials at the International Criminal Court, which has issued an arrest warrant for Vladimir Putin over a war crime charge.

title: NATO: West faces differences over Ukraine's membership
description: Members of the alliance are considering security guarantees for Ukraine, in anticipation of the Vilnius summit scheduled for July.

title: 'Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3': A perilous final mission
description: James Gunn's new and final installment of the most pleasant Marvel franchise shines a light on his love of American fantasy cinema.

title: Tunisian President Kais Saied calls criticism of his repressive policies 'lies'
description: After the controversy caused by the withdrawal of two books from the Tunis International Book Fair, the leader attacked the foreign media that referred to it as censorship.

title: The Kremlin, the heart of Russian power, targeted by drones
description: Moscow denounced what it called a Ukrainian attack and 'assassination attempt' against Vladimir Putin. Ukraine denied any involvement.

title: Pension reform: After new rejection by Constitutional Council, France questions referendum procedure
description: After France's top constitutional authority ruled against the request for a referendum on the retirement age filed by left-wing lawmakers, some are wondering whether the referendum mechanism is designed to fail.

title: French Parliament wants to address housing crisis by regulating Airbnb
description: Four MPs are launching a cross-party appeal aimed at eliminating the tax break for renting furnished tourist accommodation, while Renaissance MPs are finalizing a bill on the same topic.

title: Meta, Microsoft find Iranian hackers behind multiple cyber attacks
description: New information made public by Meta and Microsoft this week shows that 'Iranian threat actors' have improved their hacking and cyber capabilities, targeting various organizations, including French satirical magazine 'Charlie Hebdo' in January.

title: Cannes 2023 jury: Ruben Ostlund to be joined by Brie Larson, Paul Dano
description: The film festival panel also includes Julia Ducournau, Denis Menochet, Rungano Nyoni, Atiq Rahimi Damian Szifron and Maryam Touzani.

title: War in Ukraine: String of drone attacks target Kyiv and Russian oil refinery
description: Ukraine's air force said it shot down 18 of the 24 Russian drones while an 'unidentified drone' caused a fire at an oil refinery's reservoir in southern Russia.

title: Fed raises interest rates for 10th time as fourth bank collapse looms
description: Rates rose above 5% for the first time since 2007, but the US Federal Reserve has left the door open to a pause.

title: European Commission unveils anti-corruption directive
description: Brussels wants to harmonize member states' regulations and has announced the creation of a new sanctions regime. NGOs welcomed a small step in the right direction but are calling for a supervisory body for European institutions.

title: Belarusian journalist Roman Protasevich is latest victim of regime's endless crackdown
description: Arrested after his flight was hijacked and used as a puppet by the regime and humiliated even in his private life, the 27-year-old former blogger was sentenced on Wednesday to eight years in a penal colony.

title: Muslim, Scottish Asian, and only 38: Humza Yousaf's singular rise
description: Tasked with putting Scotland and the Scottish National Party back on track, the first minister draws strength and pride from his background.

title: Morocco is teaming up with Spain and Portugal to host the 2030 World Cup
description: Diplomatic, geographical and strategic reasons lie behind the joint bid. The trio is the odd-on choice against its South American rivals.

title: 'Apartheid regime' resolution underscores French left's divisions on Israel
description: The Assemblée Nationale will vote Thursday on a resolution written by a Communist MP condemning 'the institutionalization by the state of Israel of an apartheid regime.' The other left-wing parties do not all agree.

title: In western Libya, deforestation, drought and urbanization 'have destroyed everything'
description: Institutional chaos since the fall of Muammar Gaddafi's regime in 2011 has weakened state regulatory bodies and relegated environmental protection to the background.

title: UK elections: In Chichester, the opposition hopes to capitalize on Conservative disappointment
description: The local elections on May 4 will be a test for Rishi Sunak's Tory government before the next UK general election in 2024.
